intro: [WRONG START] Embilia ottoniana, commonly known as the Mexican embelia or wild pepper, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
